task.title: Turning clipping boundaries on and off
task.shortdesc: The clipping boundaries can be controlled whether to display or not through system variable

context.p: XCLIPFRAME. If set this systemvariable to 1, the clipping boundary can be selected and plotted as a part of the object.

When a clipping boundary is turned off, the boundary does not display and the entire external reference is visible, provided that the geometry is on a layer that is on and thawed. However, deleting a clipping boundary is permanent.
To turn clipping boundaries on and off

step.cmd: Choose Modify > Clip> Xref from the mainmenu.
To turn off clipping boundaries, choose OFF. To turnon existingclipping boundaries, choose ON.
Enter an option and then press Enter.

result.p: TIP When the XCLIPFRAME system variable is on (set to 1), you can select and print the clipping boundary frame.
